text: Welcome to the Canadian Rockies!

In the last video we showed you the 4-and-a-half
day car journey from Ontario, but now it’s
time to jump into the sightseeing.

We had 1 full week in the Rockies, splitting
our time between both Alberta and British

Columbia, and all of our days were spent hiking
in woods, visiting the lakes, and just enjoying
being surrounded by nature.

This was a family road trip with our trusty
family dog Togo in tow, so we’re going to

be sharing with you our adventure in what
may well be the most beautiful part of Canada!

here exploring Alberta.

Paint Pots consist of 3 pools made up of cold
mineral springs, surrounded by earth predominantly

composed of iron ore, which stains the ground
an orangey-red color.

A nearby stream then flows into the 2 larger
pools creating a greenish color.

Later that day we drove to Moraine Lake, which
is another glacially fed lake.

It has a brilliant blue-green colour due to
light refracting off the rock sediments, and

like most destinations in the Rockies, this
one was another stunner.
